intro: Faramea orinocencis, commonly known as the Orinoco faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly found in countries like Colombia, Venezuela, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
